byline.contributor: Vinod Sreeharsha contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, and Paula Moura from São Paulo.

abstract: Brazil's lower house of Congress speaker Waldir Maranhao annuls presidential impeachment vote against Dilma Rousseff just two days before vote was scheduled to take place; contends that procedural rules had been broken in impeachment vote and lower house should hold new one; move throws country into further chaos.
lead_paragraph: Politicians scrambled to determine how the decision by the new speaker of Brazil’s lower house of Congress might affect President Dilma Rousseff’s fate.

headline.main: Brazil Reels Again as Impeachment Vote Is Declared Invalid
headline.print_headline: Brazil Reels Again as Impeachment Vote Is Declared Invalid

snippet: Politicians scrambled to determine how the decision by the new speaker of Brazil’s lower house of Congress might affect President Dilma Rousseff’s fate.
